clinical_study.brief_title: Emotion Regulation in Binge Eating and Purging Among Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Neural Correlates of Emotion Regulation and Executive Function in Binge Eating and Purging Among Adolescents

brief_summary.textblock: The study will examine the neural and behavioral correlates of emotion regulation in adolescents engaging in binge eating and/or purging and healthy adolescents. Furthermore, it will look at the influence of executive function on emotion regulation in this population. This study will allow us to gain further understanding of the neural basis of emotion regulation in this age group. Moreover, this study supports the need to develop new treatment approaches based on a better understanding of the brain processes associated with eating disorders.

primary_outcome.description: Functional magnetic resonance imaging will be used to measure brain activity during a task where participants respond to images of faces with emotional expressions overlaid with an emotion word written in text. We will focus on brain response during this task when emotion face vs word are in conflict.
Functional magnetic resonance imaging will be used to measure brain activity during a task where participants attempt to regulate emotional responses.

primary_outcome.measure: Brain activity during cognitive control and emotion response
primary_outcome.description: Functional magnetic resonance imaging will be used to measure brain activity during a task where participants engage in cognitive control and respond to emotional stimuli.

secondary_outcome.measure: Behavioral performance on emotion conflict task
secondary_outcome.description: Response times will be used as behavioral measure on the emotion conflict task

secondary_outcome.measure: Behavioral performance on emotion regulation task
secondary_outcome.description: Emotion ratings will be used as behavioral measure on the emotion regulation task

secondary_outcome.measure: Behavioral performance on cognitive control and emotion regulation task
secondary_outcome.description: Emotion ratings will be used as behavioral measure on the cognitive control and emotion regulation task

arm_group.description: Adolescents engaging in recurrent binge eating and/or purging behavior.
Adolescents who do not have a history of eating disorders

intervention.description: We will conduct MRI and fMRI brain scans to compare brain function between groups.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female
- Ages 15-18
- with or without current binge eating and/or purging behaviors
Exclusion Criteria:
We exclude patients of clinically significant low weight (<85% ideal body weight using CDC norms for height, age, and gender) and those with contraindications for MRI (e.g., orthodontia, metallic implants). Participants also will be without evidence of current or past major neurological (e.g., seizures, psychosis, head trauma) or major sensory deficit.
